Bachelor of Science in Applied Mathematics and Statistics; Honours in Statistics and Masters in Economics

Within Deloitte, I lead the Analytics Academy program, and I am passionate about driving a data culture change and equipping individuals and their organizations for the future of AI.

profile_positions.description:
I am a Data and Analytics Lead at Deloitte Consulting in the Netherlands with a focus on the Financial Services Industry. 
In the past two years I have led projects at ING, Rabobank and ABN AMRO from the strategic transformation leading to value delivery for the business 

Within Deloitte, I lead the Analytics Academy program, and I am passionate about driving a data culture change and equipping individuals and their organizations for the future of AI.
profile_positions.title: Data and Analytics Transformation Lead, FSI

profile_positions.description:
I moved to Rand Merchant Bank (the investment banking division in the First Rand Group) to grow the data analytics capability by leveraging my strong technical and strategic background.

I led a data analytics team whose core function was to utilize a  data science approach to proactively provide solutions to business to improve organizational performance and reduce costs.

The businesses drive towards digitization was supported by my team through the enhancement of operational analytics and partnership with the technology, infrastructure, and digital teams within the First Rand Group.

The analytics solution we offered comprised of insights on business activity (headcount, spending); risk tracking (code of conduct); UX analytics (text mining); forecasting models (attrition, budget); AI solutions (automation of processes); and machine learning (transformation, cost optimization).

Data and record stewardship resided within the team to ensure that reliability, accessibility and timeliness of data was maintained.

The opportunity to empower employees with new skills and positive influence in a changing environment was a fulfilling aspect of my role.
profile_positions.title: Head of Data and Analytics

profile_positions.description:
First National Bank was named the most innovative African Bank for two years, as well as the best digital bank in South Africa. Spending almost 5 years as a Strategy Analyst servicing the First Rand Group put me at the forefront of innovation.

My work was consultative and predominantly focused on predictive model building and analytics which permitted a proactive workforce management programme, assisted with mitigating people risks, provided cost saving solutions, and allowed the business to understand employee behaviour.

I was involved in multiple projects which involved collaboration between the front and back office operational teams, as this allowed us to leverage a broader range of data from which we could build more meaningful customer targeting models and therefore optimise digital platform offerings.

I have won multiple innovation awards for forecasting and machine learning models which have since been implemented in the business.
profile_positions.title: Strategy Analytics Lead

profile_positions.description:
As the Senior Business Analyst at Brownstone Marketing Analytics,  I managed the end-to-end analytics service to our clients in the banking, telecommunications, insurance and personal services industries.

My role involved leading a team of analysts and developers; engaging with clients to understand their business problems; and thereafter defining a strategic solution. This included identifying initial data processes; selection criteria for products; and campaign management.

Within the organisation I was responsible for the development of predictive models to optimize campaign performance and ROI; the introduction of new methodologies for updating the company's database; management of existing campaign initiation channels; and the development of alternative direct and indirect channels. This resulted in customized channel management strategies for clients.

The role allowed me to become a stronger leader in the business as well as a profitable campaign manager to the clients. The dynamic nature of the business attributed to the development of my technical skills and machine learning capabilities.
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
A research area was developed in Statistics South Africa in 2007 and I was fortunate to have been one of the first to join. 

A national statistical office is bound by legislation in most of the output produced, however,  the research area was an innovation hub which afforded me the opportunity to explore new avenues.

My role involved research and analytics in areas of economic interest which would ultimately lead to the production of new indices.

Research on best practices of other statistical agencies coupled with collaborative work with counterparts from these offices contributed to the success of my work. My programme management and reporting skills developed in this role.

Due to my strong methodological and communication skills, I was seconded to the Producer Price Index (PPI) re-engineering project. I visited stakeholders throughout South Africa and conducted research on the most popular products which should be used for the calculation of the PPI. This assisted with developing methodologies for the index. 

I managed a team of price collectors and subsequently provided training to team members for the handover of the project
profile_positions.title: Principal Economist

profile_positions.description:
After a year on the internship programme at Statistics South Africa, I joined the Financial Statistics area as a survey statistician.

I was responsible for monitoring the collection and processing of data for the annual and quarterly financial surveys; visiting key stakeholders; analysis of data; compilation of statistical publications; and writing statistical programs to facilitate these procedures.

This role allowed me to utilize my strong programming and report writing skills and grow my stakeholder management skills.
profile_positions.title: Survey Statistician

profile_positions.description:
The internship programme was a 12 month training contract to gain experience; understand the various functional areas of the organisation; and develop the required skills. 

I spent my year in 3 areas. 

My initial placement was in the programming division where I primarily worked on SAS and built my coding skills in base SAS before moving onto SAS Enterprise Guide and JMP.

I then moved onto marketing which involved analyzing the organisations current products and stakeholders in an effort to improve product and information delivery.

Lastly, I explored the Data Management and Information Delivery Project to gain a deeper understanding in creating infrastructure and standardized processes
